region: East Turkestan / Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region
description: The Uyghur people are a Turkic ethnic group native to the Xinjiang region of Northwest China. Since 2017, the Chinese government has implemented mass detention, surveillance, and cultural suppression policies targeting Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities. Human rights organizations estimate that over 1 million people have been detained in internment camps described by China as vocational education centers.
key_facts: Uyghurs are a Turkic-speaking Muslim ethnic group with distinct culture and language
Region was historically known as East Turkestan before Chinese incorporation
Mass detention camps established from 2017 onwards
Estimated 1-1.8 million detained in re-education camps
Extensive surveillance system including facial recognition and DNA collection
Reports of forced labor, family separation, and cultural suppression
UN Human Rights office found potential crimes against humanity in 2022 report
Over 16,000 mosques damaged or destroyed according to ASPI analysis
international_response: UN Human Rights assessment (2022) found serious human rights violations
EU imposed sanctions on Chinese officials (2021)
Multiple countries boycotted Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics
sources: UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR)
